comments.body: why do I disable it ref: https://github.com/koalaman/shellcheck/wiki/SC1091

Thanks for the link!

I question whether this entire block is necessary
- https://cs.k8s.io/?q=ENABLE_PROXY&i=nope&files=&repos=
- https://cs.k8s.io/?q=/tmp/kube-proxy-env&i=nope&files=&repos=

As far as I can tell, it used to be used by cluster/openstack-heat/util.sh

Is there an issue or announcement we can link to here to provide more context about the deprecation? Also, if someone sees this message and immediately panics and wants to convince us **not** to remove this support, how should they proceed? A little clarity up front will help us organize any support pings we get in the future.

What @pipejakob said
Also we could state the timeline up front here (removal in v1.9?)
@luxas @pipejakob Done. GCE is going to be a PITA to remove and it's currently unstaffed so I'm leaving it out of the list.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +50,54 @@!!! DEPRECATION NOTICE !!!

The '${provider}' kube-up provider is deprecated and will be removed in a future
release of kubernetes. Deprecated providers will be removed within 2 releases.

comments.body:
As the pull request builder just demonstrated, this doesn't quite work. You're not sourcing `kube-util` anywhere here, so `validate-cluster` is just a naked command that doesn't exist yet.

Can you describe what you're trying to do? It almost looks like you're trying to implement virtual functions in bash. That almost works? And it's a method I've considering going down before, I think you have a bit of a longer road ahead of you that involves plumbing every single existing provider (but I might be wrong).

I think we have 2 options:
1. have common source kube-util
2. require cluster utils to source kube-util or implement all its functions

The way I have it working in cluster/mesos/docker/util is option 2: sourcing the default impls and then overriding them. But I neglected to update the gce util to do so.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +38,42 @@
echo "... calling validate-cluster" >&2
validate-cluster

echo -e "Done, listing cluster services:\n" >&2
